results.title: Some Australian birds
results.creator_credit: S.T. Evans, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and CSIRO
results.brief_description: The work of the wild life survey section of the CSIRO. Includes close study of the function of the lyrebird’s mimicry; the nesting habits of the mallee fowl, a shy bird which builds a high mound; the king penguin which lives on Macquarie Island in large colonies, and the Tasmanian mutton birds which support a small industry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: S.T. Evans, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and CSIRO

results.title: Some American sculpture
results.creator_credit: Frederick H Stein, Sketches and United States Information Service
results.brief_description: Offers a view of the work, philosophy and work habits of three modern American sculptors - Jennie Lea Knight who works with wood; George Mueller who works with steel; and, Fred Eversley who works with plastic.

results.title: Solutions
results.brief_description: Examples of the price we pay in our deteriorating environment for the misuse of road traffic. In contrast we see the modern railway system offering an already existing solution to our crowded island’s transport problems. A film without commentary.

results.title: Solomon Islands regain independence
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: On July 7, 1978, Solomon Islands regained its independence from Britain. Looks at the people of these islands and studies their way of life through their comments, songs and dances. Describes the problems facing the new nation and what is being done to combat them. Pidgin dialogue, English dialogue, English subtitles.

results.title: Solo
results.creator_credit: Mike Hoover, David Adams and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Mike Hoover as the climber portrays the efforts and exhilarations that are experienced by the solo mountain climber. Filmed in Mexico, the United States and Canada on 21 different climbs this story explores the pleasures and dangers of mountain climbing by presenting three aspects of climbing of which the non-climber is rarely aware. These are the driving rhythm of sustained physical effort, the discovery of scenes and weathers unknown to others and the commitment to challenges which must be met alone.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Hoover, David Adams and Pyramid Films

results.title: Solids, liquids and gases: Newton's laws of motion (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Millington, Barrie Whatley, British Broadcasting Corporation and Open University
results.brief_description: Experimental evidence for Newton’s laws of motion is examined and a number of experiments are demonstrated to show the effect of forces on a massive concrete sphere. Illustrates concepts like kinetic and potential energy, compressional energy and the behaviour of matter in a force free environment
results.title_for_label: Solids, liquids and gases: Newton’s laws of motion (TEFC)

results.title: Solar family
results.brief_description: The evolution of the solar system revealed according to the planetesimal hypothesis, followed by a portrayal of the real and apparent motion of the planets. Among the special phenomena presented are: the phases of Venus; retrograde motion of Mars; Jupiter and its satellites; the apparent motion of Saturn’s rings; orbits of the planetoids, Eros and Anteros; orbit of Halley’s comet; and the motion of the solar system in space.

results.title: Sojourn in rural Japan: a youth hostel trip
results.creator_credit: Japan. National Tourist Organisation and Shu Taguchi Productions
results.brief_description: A youth hostel trip in the Tohoku district where, more than in any other part of Japan, the old and simple ways still remain. This film shows the Towada National Park and the Yamagata and Hiraizumi areas which attract young people all the year round.
results.title_for_label: Sojourn in rural Japan: a youth hostel trip

results.title: Soil fertility in South Africa
results.creator_credit: South Africa. Dept. of Education. Film Services Union and South African Government
results.brief_description: A note of warning is sounded and attention focused on various malpractices which lead to the deterioration or total destruction of the thin layer of fertile top soil. Remedial and preventative measures are explained and the farmer is encouraged to co-operate with the State in its campaign against retrogressive practices.
